etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Mosasaurus, from Latin Mosa, ‘Meuse’ (the river near which it was first discovered) + Greek sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a large extinct marine reptile of the late Cretaceous period, with large toothed jaws, paddle-like limbs, and a long flattened tail, related to the monitor lizards.

notes.text: Family Mosasauridae, suborder Lacertilia: several genera, including Mosasaurus

shortDefinitions: large fossil marine reptile of late Cretaceous period
